website_summaries.verdict: The best budget floorstanding speaker for anyone looking to upgrade their home audio system for less.
pros: Sound production is clean and clear thanks to the premium speakers and simple design
Low-end reproduction is more accurate and noticeable
Speaker is compatible with most amplifiers and stereo systems
cons: Speakers require the rest of the sound system for the best audio results

website_summaries.verdict: The Polk T50 is a remarkably decent-sounding tower speaker for not a lot of money, but it faces stiff competition.
pros: The big Polk T50 tower speakers sound very good for the money
They look sharp, too, and feature a 1-inch tweeter, 6.5-inch woofer and two 6.5-inch bass radiators
cons: The Pioneer SP-PK52FS sounds better and costs the same
The Polk is only available in a black, wood-grain vinyl finish
Its treble detailing can, on some recordings, sound harsh

customer_reviews.title: Does Not By These Speakers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these speaker in 2017. I just rearrange my living and something seem wrong with my tower speaker. So I pulled the speakers out and found out 2 of them are fake. If you by them make sure to take the apart so make sure you have real speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Love them - Great for Music/TV/Movies in a smallish room
customer_reviews.text: After reading some reviews about how these handle movies/TV sound I was a little hesitant to buy these, but I'm so glad I did. For $70, these are some of the best speakers I've heard. Great bass response, clear mids and highs. I think these are great for movies/TV (probably because I don't care about surround sound) and they are perfect for music. The room I'm in is 13x19 with hard wood floors and tall ceilings, and these fill it up with sound. Using them with an Onkyo A-9050 stereo receiver. Definitely glad I took a chance on these.
customer_reviews.author: C. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great sound!
customer_reviews.text: These produce amazing sound considering their relatively small size. Replaced massive "old school" floor speakers which I could barely lift. These weight about 20 pounds apiece, making them quite liftable by anyone. I'm using them in stereo formation, not 5.1 or 7.1 or any of these newfangled setups (you can tell I'm old as dirt, can't you?).
customer_reviews.author: gigi

customer_reviews.title: ARRIVED BROKEN THREE TIMES !!
customer_reviews.text: I sure would like to get a chance to HEAR what these speakers sound like but ALL THREE DELIVERIES arrived BROKEN !! Obviously time to try another brand, another vendor, perhaps someone will have a box and packing materials that would result in the buyer receiving UNDAMAGED items .............................................. (By the way I tried SEVERAL times calling POLK directly just to request a replacement plastic grill instead of keep sending entire speakers back, but every time a phione message automatically says excessive call volume and then HANGS UP !! Great Customer Service Polk Audio, I shall tell my friends !!!!!!!!)
customer_reviews.author: FloridaWen

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: Did a bit of research on many bookshelf speakers. Reveiws for these were good and now that I have them I see why. They are GREAT. loud clear sound. look at the price and think they can't be that good ( get what you pay for) well with these they surpassed my expectations. Highly recommended easy hook up with speaker wire thats is not included. They can also be hung on the wall to save space.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Mac

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers. Decent bass response for small bookshelf speakers
customer_reviews.text: Great speakers. Decent bass response for small bookshelf speakers. Hooked up to vintage pioneer receiver. Sounds fantastic. Small room application... 400 sq ft
customer_reviews.author: P. Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Amazing speaker
customer_reviews.text: This sounds awesome! Amazing bass. Looks very nice and sleek. Husband is so picky and he loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Essa Cole

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, great price!
customer_reviews.text: Blew out my old center channel speaker, and I replaced it with this line from Polk. I liked the sound even better the I expected. So much in fact, I bought the whole line and replaced all my speakers! They aren't low profile/slim but if you have the room, then you can't beat the quality for this price!
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: waste of money. Junk.
customer_reviews.text: The speakers lasted 3 days. Heard aloud noise sounding like a truck without a muffler. Then I saw smoke pouring from the grill. I won’t bother with the warranty.l am very disappointed and threw them in the trash. Stank my house up with a nasty burnt electrical smell.you get no star for this kind crap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Got these for our new house at my parents' request. PROS: - Great high quality speakers - Easy to set up - Minimalistic look - Easy to place due to size - Great customer service CONS: - Can't really think of any this time
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers.
customer_reviews.text: Killer sound at an unbeatable price. Polk Audio is a audiophile on a budgets dream. Crystal clear treble and nice natural sounding bass.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Speaker not only for the way it looks but for the way it sounds!
customer_reviews.text: I received my Polk Center Channel speaker today. This picture shows the difference in the size between my JBL's and Polk's. I did not realize that it was going to be that size, not that that's a bad thing. They look great and sound even better! I am impressed with the way they perform and everything sounds crisp and clean. I recommend them highly. The price nice too.
customer_reviews.author: JimmyLongHair

customer_reviews.title: Blown speaker & no woofer wiring
customer_reviews.text: I have had these speakers for less than 1-1/2 years. Already a speaker is blown (mid range). The stereo is rated for less watts per channel than the speakers. When I took the speakers off I found that the 2nd mid-range and woofer are not even wired up. They are not functioning speakers. 2 wires (1 for the tweeter, 1 for a mid-range). I would not have noticed this without disassembly. I am very dissatisfied with these speakers, and will not purchase Polk products again.
customer_reviews.author: Erich Kemp

customer_reviews.title: Sound great!
customer_reviews.text: These sound great. Good lows an highs. I thought my wife was going to freakout when she saw how big they were. I put them by the TV and had the stereo on when she got home. And quote "Those sound nice and they look good". Oh and the plastic mesh behind the speaker covers are great for keeping little fingers out! I was worried about out just walking grand kids playing with them, but they just dance in front of them.
customer_reviews.author: ChuckRock

customer_reviews.title: 10 stars, and probably no more than the cost of shipping.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic sound for what is probably the cost of shipping (from China to front door)! I don't know how Amazon does it? No complaints. Be SURE to order some banana plugs, they make reconfiguring your system a breeze. 10 Stars.
customer_reviews.author: PaulTD

customer_reviews.title: The best desktop/bookshelf speakers at this discounted price
customer_reviews.text: At the original price of $100, these are a good choice for desktop/bookshelf speakers; but at the discounted price of $50, these are unbeatable. Paired with a decent Class D amplifier (see below), you are in an honest entry-level hi-fi world. It's an entirely different world compared to your typical PC-based USB speakers. Beyond this, you may be spending tens of times more but getting only marginal improvements. Example of a good Class D amplifier is Fosi Audio:
customer_reviews.author: Gao Atamazon

customer_reviews.title: Awful sounding speakers
customer_reviews.text: I have owned nice sounding Polk speakers in the past and currently own very high quality speakers for my main sound system. Bought these and a Sony receiver to improve the flat screen TV sound at a friend's house. They sound worse than the built in speakers, if you can imagine that. Muddy sound throughout the frequency range and very poor spatial imaging. Replaced with a pair of inexpensive Micca speakers, which sound far better. Very disappointing for a product from Polk.
customer_reviews.author: pam weppler

customer_reviews.title: Hear all you’ve missed!
customer_reviews.text: This center channel speaker is great. I had an old Sony I’d been meaning to replace to match my Polk tower speakers. The clarity is amazing and I swear I heard sounds and dialog I’d never heard before. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Bo Beard

customer_reviews.title: Nice CENTER channel speaker.
customer_reviews.text: First time Polk Audio owner and was very pleased with the clarity and out put of this center channel speaker. Great price point to performance ratio. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brett B

customer_reviews.title: These are fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my 20+ year old speakers (since I blew them...) and these are so much better. Sound is clear, they are sturdy and ready to use right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Lois J Knabel

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: I finally had to give up my large floor standing speakers when I moved from my house to an apartment, but have been very pleased with the way these very reasonably priced Polk Audio speakers sound. I also had one crash and burn off of a shelf about 2 feet above the floor, and it survived with no apparent harm. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: AzAlum

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a little biased because I have worked around and radio stations, concert halls and theaters. I know what the speakers are supposed to sound like, and this is not it. The bass is a joke, not much treble, and mostly mids, so the sound is very tinny. I bought these as my main living room speakers but should’ve known better because as always, you get what you pay for. These would be “just ok” as rear channel speakers on a surround sound system, which I think is what they were meant to be. Will return.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get what all the fuss is about
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are not that good. Plugged them in expecting great value and these speakers are average at best. For the price ($69 at the the time of this review) they are good for certain applications- kids room, workshop, a place where they could get broken and you wouldn’t care. Exaggerated highs, not enough low, weak mid- produces an unbalanced sound. For the price I’d roll the dice on a pair of Dayton Audio Airs. They are cheaper and although I haven’t personally listened to them, have to sound better than these. At the very least they are $20 less per pair.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Horrible.
customer_reviews.text: Product showed up used (nicks), with a receipt in the bottom of box from a Best Buy in Florida dated 12/12/17. One of the speakers did not work, and after reviewing the order that stated "new", I realized I was over charged $20. I am a loyal customer of Amazon but will be watching out for this nonsense moving forward.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as great as I expected
customer_reviews.text: These came packaged well and are good looking speakers. I bought the 2 towers, Center channel & rear wall mount speakers. I ran these through a new Yamaha A/V receiver. The sound is good but nothing like theater quality sound. I can rarely even distinguish a change in the surround or that music/sound is coming out of different speakers. It really sounds like all of it comes from the center speaker. Maybe the folks at Polk see this and have a magic solution??
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money, not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, they are power hungry and have flat spots (sound wise). Overall good for the price. If you are using a receiver that has over 200 Watts you may have to crank the volume up before you get a overall picture of the sound quality. At low volumes you don't get much out of the speakers which isn't a bad thing, they can really handle power. Being a two-way speaker you get flat spots in the high range but all speakers have faults. My opinion: use in a 2.1 setup with a 10in or 12in subwoofer, keep the at least 4ft apart.
customer_reviews.author: Thrift Trend

customer_reviews.title: These are excellent speakers in a small,compact size.I recommend these as bookshelf or rear surround speakers!
customer_reviews.text: These Polk Audio T15 speakers I received this afternoon, worked perfectly well as rear surround speakers!These replaced a small pair of used Cam bridge speakers that were woefully inadequate as surround speakers.Now whenever I play" Neutron Dance","The Heat is On"and "Axel F"from the "Beverly Hills Cop" soundtrack, there are no more weak links in the chain! Currently there are two Polk tower speakers in my living room,a Klipsch center channel and a Hsu VTF-2 MK3 Subwoofer and my new Polk Audio T15 speakers.All of these speakers and the subwoofer are connected to my Onkyo THX TS-DS 777 with 10 gauge wire.Installation was very easy,since the new speakers went exactly where the previous ones were.
customer_reviews.author: Cleveland E. Norton Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Movie enjoyment upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: After I've seen and been impressed by reviews and ratings for Polk audio speakers over the years i finally pulled the trigger on this center channel. Good job Polk! My last center channel speaker did it's part but gave up the ghost recently. This Polk replaces it with resolve and panache. Widening my sound field enjoyment during UHD movie playback.😳so good 👍.
customer_reviews.author: Darth Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful and affordable!
customer_reviews.text: Blew out my old center channel speaker, this is an afforable replacement for a great company. The sound is even better the I expected. So good in fact i bought the whole line and replaced all my speakers!
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: good sounding little speakers
customer_reviews.text: The power of Polk Audio is displayed again by their fine products. This is not a review for I have owned the original Polk speakers for many years, so I knew what to expect. In wanting to add 5.1.2 to my new system I decided to stay with the Polks' that are so versatile they could be front, surrounds or in my case rear speakers. I really appreciate the styling update along with construction and finish. I have these mounted 6 feet high 10 feet behind my seating area so the warmth of the sonic(s) reach my ears slightly after my mains. Polk, good job.
customer_reviews.author: G. Latham

customer_reviews.title: Would Buy em’ Again
customer_reviews.text: Took a chance buying these speakers not having heard them play based on my understanding of Polk’s reputation as a quality speaker company. Very happy w the breath of range including deep enough bass not to add a subwoofer (using bass boost from the Sony amp). These replaced much larger/heavier speakers. Sound projects well from diagonal corners; quality is tremendous in a vaulted 16x20 room. Dolby sureound is theater quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I bought these speakers for surround sound on my TV. Small room, therefore no need for large speakers. They are a disappointment although better than the TV speakers. Lack of precision in the treble, extremely aggressive (distorted) medium and total lack of bass (nothing at 60 Hz). I highly recommend spending 2x the money and buying JBL of Klipsch.
customer_reviews.author: Emilie

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for the money. Probably better than 90% of the homeowners in American would settle for.
customer_reviews.text: I was very surprised at the sound quality for the money. Note however that I also have a dedicated Sub attached to the system... So I'm not relying on these speakers to deliver a ton of bass. Not saying they will not.. just saying I have not used them in a manner that would test the bass as much as some may want..so I cannot comment. Great sound for the money. Probably better than 90% of the homeowners in American would settle for. If you compare these to speakers 3-5x as much or more.. go spend the money and buy those. For the money I spent on these... They are fantastic
customer_reviews.author: ЄXͭΐͪѤͤD ßυяи✯ⓒⓑ

customer_reviews.title: No cables/cords included
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with zero cords / cables. Just two speakers, and nothing with which to connect them to my desktop; nor any power cord either. I cannot comment on the sound quality due to this compete lack of connector cords / cables. Returning for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: K. Mulholland

customer_reviews.title: A Good Deal Until You Want Something More
customer_reviews.text: I shouldn't complain. These are inexpensive speakers. A good half ofbthe reason Ibbought them was because they were cheap and they also saved me the expense of speaker stands. So...you get what you pay for. As for quality, for surround sound they are fine. As two channel speakers for music they are more disappointing. They just bring nothing to the table. I have more special moments with my little Klipsch R-41Ms than I do with these.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan F. Koelber

customer_reviews.title: I returned these
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know I needed a receiver of some kind to use these cute speakers. I returned them. My Sony TV is two years old and has dreadful sound. I was trying to solve it. But no.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy D. Solomon

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Bang for the Buck
customer_reviews.text: Choosing speakers is really tricky. Different situations and preferences usually drive a person's decision. Used these to replace larger (20" high) bookshelf speakers that lost their mojo (whatever that is). Have a pretty decent receiver (Denon AVR-S900W) and center channel speaker. Tempted by the simplicity of a sound bar but could never pull the trigger on such a purchase. Placed these on 30" stands flanking a 50" Samsung TV. Very pleased with the balanced sound. Hard to beat at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Reinehr

customer_reviews.title: Terrible sound. Spend more money and get decent speakers.
customer_reviews.text: Spend more and get a decent speaker. These fart with lows and distort with highs. $20 worth of Chinese crap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not same old cabinet spkr sound, lacks good bass kick you expect.
customer_reviews.text: I hate how manufacturers have shorted consumers out of the way the old style spkr cabinets used to sound with plenty of bass. Gut thumping bass. Instead they give u somethibg with a simulated bass sound and force you into a subwoofer which still diesnt sound the same nor provides that bass kick you feel like you used to. I see where you might be able to obtain a speaker like i mentioned that sounds like the old cabinet ones but whos got $1500+ or more for each speaker?
customer_reviews.author: Tony T

customer_reviews.title: Wow, what a deal
customer_reviews.text: What needs to match with these speakers is the correct power balance of bass and treble....it MUST be done to get these lil' guys to "put out"....suddenly, the sound explodes from these things....but they must have their "hands held" in different genre and generation sounds....the old 70s stu...it can come out with a bit of work....like a fine watch, they do need attention. Enjoy "making" sound with these....IT'S FUN! For under a 100 bucks, what a deal! No subwoofer is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Dave in CO

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal!
customer_reviews.text: Great price when I got two of these on sale! For the price range the sound is great! high - highs and low - lows. Punchy bass and crisp tweeters. You can tell the difference between someone playing the bass guitar and someone playing the bass drum (yes they can sound alike on some speakers/systems). After the sale they went to the regular price which is the same as Best Buy. Even at regular price they would still be a good investment/addition to a home theater.
customer_reviews.author: RayTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Initial impression is favorable.
customer_reviews.text: I am just getting into the surround sound set up being a looooong time audiophile. My long standing Yamaha amp bit the dust and I wanted to move past the 'patching' I was doing between old and new tech. Anyway, part of my setup was getting the Polk T-series for center, rear and sub to augment existing Bose tower mains. I am still setting up and adjusting. so critical review is premature. Initial reaction is that clarity of center audio in surround is every good. I'll report back after I get everything adjusted and listen to both video surround sound and familiar music.
customer_reviews.author: J. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value, great sounding
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these to replace my parents' blown-out vintage Marantz Imperial 5G speakers. Difference was like night and day (as expected). Pros: * High, mid, low are all tight and well balanced. Everything just sounded right from multiple sources. * Straightforward speakers. Nothing fancy for my parents to deal with. * Great build quality. Solid materials, slick finish, sturdy grille, secure connectors. * Fantastic value for money. Cons: * Tall and skinny, so they're not too stable on carpet. * Not miracle workers. They're not going to rock your world.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: I admit I was building a surround sound system on a budget, but I couldn't be happier with the sound of these speakers. Paired the T30 Center channel with the T15 Bookshelf speakers and the PSW10 10" powered sub-woofer. Great sound, immersive effects and fills the whole room like I am right there in the movie and music.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair for the front of a 5.1 system. Within weeks, moved them to the rear and replaced with Polk Model 60s (much, much better). These are very muffled and lack midrange, particularly 700-1500hz or so. This became apparent when listening to music and the "growl" of the bass guitar was very low. I would recommend a higher quality bookshelf speaker over these if your budget is tight. If you can, the Polk Model series is a little more money for much better performance.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Not for my purposes...
customer_reviews.text: These speakers look quite elegant right out of the box so I had high hopes. I hooked him up to my Denon receiver and random through an eclectic mix of classical jazz Bob hard rock and blues. I also listen to a bunch of YouTube videos, and watched a couple of movies. I gave them about a week to soften up the sound. To my taste, They are OK for movies, but not for music. They are harsh sounding, aggressive, non-musical. I returned them and I got the Edifier P12 speakers instead, which I quite like. These don’t have the greatest imaging, But they sound sweet, a great bargain for the price. Adios, Polk!
customer_reviews.author: Redleb

customer_reviews.title: This speakers are great for home theater system your movies and music will ...
customer_reviews.text: This speakers are great for home theater system your movies and music will sound even better with these hooked up
customer_reviews.author: Hapner1965

customer_reviews.title: this is just one Speaker
customer_reviews.text: Despite what every image on this page show, there is only one speaker. I didn't realize I had to read the fine print on an amazon item. And don't tell me that the sellers of this item never thought it was a little weed to show two speakers in every single image. Yeah, the sound quality is decent. But you'll still need a sub woofer for bass because this doesn't have any bass. I would have given this item 4 stars if they would have been truthful. But this seller is a scam. They figure not many people will bother to return this once they get the disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: CJL

customer_reviews.title: The price was great for these speakers and they sound even better.
customer_reviews.text: After a failed attempt to re-purpose some Polk MOMO car speakers (one woofer was blown... my fault of course for years of abuse) as garage speakers, I wanted to get some good speakers on a budget. These are currently connected to a Fosi 2.1 amp (50W x2 100x1. Sub is a repurposed Pioneer 12") and sound quite good, and VERY loud for a 2 bay garage. Way better than I expected for sub $70 speakers. Even the blown car speakers I was trying to use cost originally over $150! Polk is my go to bang-for-budget speaker company. I have never been disappointed by a product. I am considering a pair for my bedroom TV setup.
customer_reviews.author: xP.1337

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality for the price was great
customer_reviews.text: Speakers are some of the best ive ever owned. My only problem was the boxes where crushed and the top of the speaker grille is craked on both speakers. The box was given to me upside down from ups and i didnt see them until later after i flipped them over and thats when i saw the boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Hays

customer_reviews.title: The heart of the T series.
customer_reviews.text: Polk fan for life. This hasn't disappointed. Great with the others in the series. Paired with a Yamaha RX-V663 and Bic F12. Rooms about 15x20 and it pounds. Went from a small monoprice 5.1 which is awesome and serves it's purose but this combo isn't comparable.
customer_reviews.author: Kane

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality, great value
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as the L/R fronts for a medium-sized media area. The room is oddly shaped and not dedicated to A/V, so I wanted to buy for value not high end. I coupled these with Polk center and subwoofer, and two Bose in-ceiling surrounds. For the price, the sound and build quality is excellent. Good bass, clear midrange and not overbearing upper. The bass definitely needs the help of a sub, but messing with the crossover will help get the right balance. They also look good (relatively understated). No regrets on this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: R. Pick

customer_reviews.title: Crystal clear audio on vinyl records, action movies, and video games
customer_reviews.text: The sound on these are absolutely amazing. I had a slight hairline fracture that was about half an inch on one of the cover guards. I bought two of these along with the center speaker to replace my old Onkyo speakers. For around $250 total for the three speakers this was an amazing upgrade. Voices in movies and in video games are now crystal clear. These are running on an Onkyo 7.1 surround sound system. I no longer have to adjust the equalizer settings if I'm doing an action movie or video game to hear the dialogue better. For the price this is my best Amazon purchase of the year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Sound with No base and cheap Mids.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes, especially given the positive reviews. I compared them to my 20 year old 2 way infinity speakers and I promptly returned the Polks. If this is your price range and you’re looking for a good sounding experience then go your local FB market place, where you’re likely to find something much better sounding for less $.
customer_reviews.author: D c

customer_reviews.title: Tweeters blow up easily
customer_reviews.text: the Tweeter blew up and now every hi pitch sound sounds like crackle. Sucks can’t return it. It’s been about two months. Well you get what you pay for. They say 150 watts my receiver only put 75 watts. They are weak speakers.
customer_reviews.author: shawn workman

customer_reviews.title: Stop thinking about it... This is a screaming buy at $69.99 !!
customer_reviews.text: Bought my set @ $99.95 a couldn't have been happier. Using these speakers in my bedroom and they work perfectly for movies and music. These are heavy speakers with quality sound and can wake the neighbors with no problem. I recently saw these on for $69 and thought Polk must be changing the to next series upgrade and wants to move inventory (I'm guessing). Regardless, don't let the price point fool you. The average user wanting big sound for the room will be pleased.
customer_reviews.author: JCEE

customer_reviews.title: Maybe for a teens bedroom . Not for adult listening
customer_reviews.text: Where to start? Speakers are half as loud as any speaker I've bought in 25 years at 100 watt from 12 channel onkyo at 8ohms. I have 25 year old 3 inch satellite that are louder and a wider frequency range.
customer_reviews.author: keith chalmers

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound for the price!
customer_reviews.text: They say you get what you pay for, but I believe I got much more than I paid for! I'm in the process of upgrading my 15 year old 5.1 home theater system. I just upgraded to a Yamaha reciever, and decided to get these polk front speakers, the difference is astronomical! These may not cut it for audiophiles, but for the average family they sure deliver! I may move these speakers to the back and get the polk towers for the front. Bottom line: great price, great quality sound, buy them! :)
customer_reviews.author: Raging45

customer_reviews.title: At retail these are still a bargain - black Friday though... DO ITTTT
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a comparison to my Atlantic Technology 1200 SAT pair I used driven by my mid 90s JVC RX-8080v. Construction wise these appear to be decently made, although they feel lighter than they should be. The bass was nearly the same from the two (I do have a subwoofer though in my setup). The mid range and high notes were totally different. The Polks had crisp clear sound with great range. The ATs were muddy in comparison. These were a great buy! I'll have my ATs up on craigslist soon :-)
customer_reviews.author: woojo

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic speakers- Exceeded expectations given the entry-level price
customer_reviews.text: Great speakers. These were purchased to replace much larger speakers when I moved my home office into a smaller room. I like listening to 80s hair metal during my workday... These fit the bill. While not earth-shattering, the dynamic range and frequency response are very pleasing. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Allums-Realtor

customer_reviews.title: Gift for a frend. This will be embarrassing...
customer_reviews.text: Both boxes having number of holes on each side. I'm not opening these boxes, they're a birthday present for a friend so I can't speak about the sound quality or the way these speakers look or work. One thing I can say is that it's going to be embarrassing to give him something that looks like it was pulled out of a dumpster....
customer_reviews.author: Zetorman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent speakers...except for wire hook-ups
customer_reviews.text: Had some giant speakers about 4 feet tall. I'm downsizing my space to save $$ to keep up with the rising cost of living. I thought I'd give these a try after getting rid of the monster speakers. Very happy with build quality and sound. They are excellent value for the $$. Only problem was the hook-ups for the speaker wires. Very hard to get your fingers in the recessed area to connect wires. It is really terrible. I had to use needle nose pliers to crank them down, could not do it with fingers alone. Who designs this stuff? A slight amount of extra room with the speaker connectors would have made them perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel D. Teoli Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Had these about a month now and I am satisfied with them, they do fine as fronts for my home theater and do better than expected when listening to music.These are not high end speakers, so I didn't expect a lot from them. One thing I noticed was that when listening to music after about 15 minutes the speakers sound better and I can hear more music, not sure if that's me getting used to listening or it really is the speakers. I would recommend these as more suited to surrounds/rears rather than as main speakers.
customer_reviews.author: ZenDodge69

customer_reviews.title: Likely best set out there for the money
customer_reviews.text: Five all the way. If they were double the price it’s a 5 star. At this price: it’s a WOW. Have owned many Polk audio home theater speakers and outdoor sets in the past and all were amazing. Pricy but great. Then they had a huge line of smaller cheaper sets for desk tops and others and were below average. So I was a tad apprehensive. Those were much better than expected. Solid base. Mid. Great pitch. They surely deliver. Using them in a nice set up in my work shop for streaming.
customer_reviews.author: mmf

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great cost, great quality.
customer_reviews.text: These are great speakers! The overall sound quality is great! Quality seems great also, but I have only had then a week so far. One note I would say is make sure you understand what a bass radiator is. It is not an actual speaker. The title of the item says deep bass response, which I would say is inaccurate. If you are using this in a home theater setup you will definitely want to pair it with a subwoofer. I knew these points going into buying them and I was fine with it since I have a sub already. So, no regrets and I am am perfectly happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Droid X2 Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality out of this pair of speakers for the $50 paid is great. I was not looking to create an incredible home theater or concert hall experience. I just wanted to marginally improve on the sound provided by my TV, and listen to records. I am using these as front speakers (no surround) and love the sound quality for the price. I can only imagine they would be great surround speakers in a home theater set up.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen S

customer_reviews.title: who is also a station engineer at a local community radio station in my city and he said that the Polk brand is a great low-price/high quality sounding speaker
customer_reviews.text: I have a dear audiophile friend, who is also a station engineer at a local community radio station in my city and he said that the Polk brand is a great low-price/high quality sounding speaker. I agree. They have a nice full sound without having any echo or tinny sound like some cheaper speakers do. They were easy to set up - as you don't need any special things other than a good gauged speaker wire. I'm really happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Aubrey

customer_reviews.title: Simply fantastic perfect for music and as part of my surround sound system.
customer_reviews.text: Finally got around to replacing the set up in my home office, which had a very nice Yamaha surround sound receiver, but was using re purposed small generic speakers. These T15s (front and rear surround) coupled with TL1 center and PSW10 sub-woofer make for and outstanding music / movie experience. All 6 speakers for less than $340. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THESE.
customer_reviews.author: JMartin

customer_reviews.title: Treble, no bass.
customer_reviews.text: These speakers sound pretty good in mid-range and highs but the deep base in the description isn’t there. The specs are 65-20k hz. I set these up in my den/ home office and use them just for FM radio. Definitely going to need a subwoofer. Polk does sell one to pair with these. In terms of quality, they are well made with quality binding posts and they look good. I would recommend them if paired with the sub or as surround speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Rsdeak

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing for Music
customer_reviews.text: These may be OK for movies as rear surrounds. But for music, these Polks are below average, even at this price point. There's just not much there. They are very muddy at mid to high volume with very little bass. When you try to add bass to them by adjusting the tone level, they distort. I tried two different high quality receivers with them (Yamaha and NAD) and had the same results. I'll likely replace the 4 I have with 2 of something better.
customer_reviews.author: P Sybe

customer_reviews.title: Sound great and the price is awesome for what you get!
customer_reviews.text: For the price these are unbeatable! I have an older home theater receiver and hooked these speakers up in the garage. They have good range and power! I like full sound and hate Bluetooth speakers. These fill the whole garage and are a million times better than my Bose revolve and other Bluetooth speakers I've tried. They don't have a ton of bass but they have as much as you would expect from a bookshelf. Inside the house I have high end B&W speakers and while these don't compare they are great for garage music! When I add a 10inch sub and 2 more of these to the system I might not leave the garage! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: David D

customer_reviews.title: Left wanting
customer_reviews.text: I have a larger room so this may affect my rating. Very lack luster bass and mid range, no presence be at all after calibrating with my Onkyo receiver. Would never use these as my main speakers. If this is a repensetation of the Polk sound I will skip them and keep looking for speakers for my surround sound speakers
customer_reviews.author: Adam S

customer_reviews.title: Previously returned item
customer_reviews.text: Product was a previous return. The packaging was bad and there was even grass inside the box. Speakers were dirty and have sticky stuff on them.
customer_reviews.author: Proateverything

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: If you are used to a Bose system as I am you will initially feel that this system is bassy. Then I realized that I was hearing a lot of midrange sound that I'd become accustomed to missing with Bose. I also am very happy with the increased clarity of voices in the center channel. Finally this T series Polk system really fills my large living room with sound.
customer_reviews.author: proton

customer_reviews.title: I was amazed at the sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: I decided to replace two small speakers that were part of a surround-sound system ... they had served admirably for almost two decades but always were a bit "small" in their sound. I need to find speakers that were not too big but with good, full, rich sound. I also did not wish to spend a fortune simply for some too-well-promoted brand. The Polk T-15's seemed right and when installed they are perfect. Well made, complement my furniture, and easily connected.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Becker

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers on a budget
customer_reviews.text: Love these speakers. They can get louder than I would have guessed. Their sound out-of-the-box is a bit heavy on the mid-range mud, but the auto-eq on my receiver/amp was able to clean it up and get really good sound out of them. I bought a sub-woofer to go wtih them because of the size of the room I put them in, but in a smaller room I think the bass on these speakers would be pretty good by themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Graeme P. Swallow

customer_reviews.title: Worst Money Ever Spent
customer_reviews.text: This was the worse purchase I ever made here...I can't hear a thing from this speakers and customer service has been reluctant to help. I'm still waiting for their response--10+ months later. I would never recommend it. I lost all respect for Polk Audio.
customer_reviews.author: cee

customer_reviews.title: Mushy indistinct sound  - could do much better even in this price range
customer_reviews.text: Given the reviews and description of these speakers we were expecting better. I'm not thinking an under-$100 speaker will sound as good as something I might spend another $100-$200 for but I know better sound reproduction can be had in this price range (for instance with a pair of Daytons). Compared with my old Boston Acoustics which were not expensive speakers 30 years ago these are miles inferior - bass is mushy, no clarity in the high end, overall a disappointing performance.
customer_reviews.author: reen

customer_reviews.title: Get a subwoofer, but amazing quality
customer_reviews.text: Bass is quite lacking, but pair these with a subwoofer and you've got yourself an absolute ballin sound system despite being on the cheaper end of the spectrum. Using these with a Polk PSW10 for a 2.1 stereo setup using a JVC surround receiver for my TV. Originally had edifier R1280t powered speakers with no subwoofer and upgraded. Difference is night and day. Hope to one day get another set and a T30 to do a 5.1 setup if I ever move and have a better room more suited for surround.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always liked Polk. I own an older pair of their tower speakers which sound great and have served well. I wanted a set of speakers for my workshop that I wasn’t worried about getting dusty... These small ones have pretty poor sound quality and no bass response. I’ve had other small speakers in the past that sounded much better. If you can afford it go for an upgraded set. Polk does a great job but these low end cheapies are exactly that.
customer_reviews.author: PMC.

customer_reviews.title: Big bang for the buck!!!
customer_reviews.text: I did not expect too much from a $100 pair of speakers and was just looking for some rear surround sound to add to my flag ship Polk Lsi 25 (not made any more) system on the mains. I was very pleasantly surprised. Wow these are a steal for sure. You can really here them shine with music. Even with a multi channel SACD. Thanks so much Amazon for putting them on sale. I'm super happy and still can't believe I got what I did for the price. Something must be wrong:)
customer_reviews.author: DJ Dave

customer_reviews.title: Very potent speakers for such a small size!
customer_reviews.text: When I first turned these on, I was sure I made a mistake. However, after a very short burn in, they really smoothed out and became quite realistic. They will certainly not overwhelm you with their bass or overall volume, but when listened to at comfortable levels, the representation of the music feels very accurate and pleasant. I purchased these in conjunction with the Onkyo TX-8260. I thought the speakers might be overwhelmed by the amp; they aren't. Although I don't crank up the volume too much, I really like their transparency and accuracy. It's a good combination.
customer_reviews.author: shopnascar

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality sound
customer_reviews.text: I've liked Polk speakers since the late '80s. So I was very disappointed with their R150's. (The high end had a terrible screech). These T50s restore my faith in Polk Audio. Highs and mids are very good, and the bass is terrific. Some of the low frequencies sound like they're in subwoofer territory (felt more than heard). Amazon gave me an astonishingly low price on Black Friday, so you might want to wait until they go on sale (which they often have).
customer_reviews.author: informal

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with the sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: These speakers sound very good for the price. You will not rattle the windows with the bass, but I don't like that anyway. They handle the output of the vintage amp I have and I could not be more pleased. The only negative was the paper clued to the top of each speaker. These were hard to get off, and I wish manufactures would stop doing that. The sound of these speaker made me forget that inconvenience after my first listening session.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Bremseth

customer_reviews.title: The Polk transparency in a small box
customer_reviews.text: The Polk transparency in a small box. If you're looking for big bass, it's not here, and that is not what they are designed for; buy a separate sub. High quality fit & finish as one expects from Polk Audio.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas K.

customer_reviews.title: Good For the Money
customer_reviews.text: I really don't like "good for the money" reviews but here I am giving you one. lol Well, they are. Description says "punchy" bass. Not so much. Little bit lacking in bass. But the price I paid is a heckuva deal for some darn good peakers. The highs and mids are actually outstandingly clear to my ear. I'm giving them a little extra bass coming out of the amp and really they are very nice. The price fluctuates. I got a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: B-Crew

customer_reviews.title: Terrific
customer_reviews.text: I’m older and was seeking a center channel speaker that provided a higher level of clarity to the spoken word. The T30 is terrific in that respect and in all other center channel respects. Certainly for audiophiles there are better choices but for the money the T30 probably would satisfy a majority of those who are looking for high quality. I paired it with a very good subwoofer and some smaller front speakers so I could get both background effect and good center spoken words. I’ve had two previous center channel speakers and a sound bar that were way less than adequate. This is terrific!
customer_reviews.author: RSN

customer_reviews.title: T15 Bookshelf speakers
customer_reviews.text: It seems the reviews for the different speaker options are mixed in here, so mine is only for the T15 bookshelf speakers. I bought these to replace an old, failing set of speakers. Just a little setup to play records. The sound is really good for the size. Decent lows, but obviously not going to get you the deep bass of a subwoofer. The price for a pair just couldn't be beat! I was expecting to pay a lot more for non-brand name speakers. I'm very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good for the money
customer_reviews.text: The speaker sound best a little off axis which is a good design for speakers intended to be stuck on or in shelves. They need a couple hours of music to break in and will sound even better after the break in period. They sound neutral without extra base or heights. I use them with a F900 bluetooth amplifier to add better sound to my TV. If you need extra base I recommend to add an active subwoofer to you the setup but even without the speakers back a good (but neutral, not overdrawn) punch. I do not regret buying them.
customer_reviews.author: Juergen Heuving

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for a few months now. I bought them to use with my new home tv setup which also included an entry-level Sony receiver. I've been very happy with them. They are beefy for their size, provide a nice balanced sound, and look sleek. I use them primarily for watching TV and movies and haven't had any problems with them like crackling or cutting out. Overall I'm quite happy with them and would happily recommend them! Blessings!
customer_reviews.author: A Branch

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Paired with the Polk 10" powered sub, these are a great value. My only gripe is the lack of the higher ends of the sound spectrum. These have a tweeter, but the highs that come from a cymbal don't come out as pronounced as I would like. Could be my amp... could be the bit-rate limitations on streaming. I am not an audiophile so you'll have to read my review with that in mind. I think, however, that for $200 for a speaker/sub combo, it is hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very enjoyable!
customer_reviews.text: I have had Polk speakers for years. From large floor speakers to ear buds and have always enjoyed their sound. This new pair has not disappointed. Work perfectly in my office with a nice Sony stereo receiver and Sony 6 disc CD player. Love it. Offers wonderful sound even at low volumes. I am hard of hearing but these speakers emphasize the right frequencies so I get a ‘perfect’ sound for my hearing.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Great
customer_reviews.text: I can't say very much more than others have already said about the high quality of these speakers. They are fantastic! I am using them with a Yamaha compact stereo CD receiver CRX-040 that outputs 15 watts per channel. It came with good speakers but these are a step up. 15 watts per channel drives them fine. I never listen at highest volume. I use Cowboy Junkies Trinity Session and Bob Dylan Tell Tale Signs to evaluate the speakers. They are superb. (The first album is on CD and the second is a high quality MP3. )
customer_reviews.author: g graham

customer_reviews.title: Great little speakers.
customer_reviews.text: These are certainly not the best speakers I've ever heard or truly amazing in any way, but I gave them five stars because they are a great value. For the price, they are very well made. Very solid construction and simple in style, I expect them to last a long time. While the sound is not amazing as I said at the beginning, it is very good. They have good bass response for such small drivers, presumably due to well designed porting, and the mids and highs are very clear and tight. Overall I'm very happy with these Polk speakers.
customer_reviews.author: tommytrekr

customer_reviews.title: I got these for my father and the sound quality is great.
customer_reviews.text: These Polk Audio T15 100 Watt Home Theater Bookshelf Speakers are exactly as described in appearance, functionality, purpose, and quality. The install was easy and required little effort. Delivery was as estimated and the product arrived well packed and protected. I got these for my father and the sound quality is great. I would recommend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger Huffman

customer_reviews.title: Polk Audio is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Set up a gym at home and pulled out my vintage circa 1984 Pioneer stereo! These speakers sound like a recording studio! They are the best speakers I have ever heard for the hi-fi sound of yesterday’s tech... Recommend for the discerning music listener that doesn’t mind running some wire. Nothing like old vinyl and cds. With the proper 35 year old sound system you can’t beat this awesome sound. I will get another set soon for the “B” input...
customer_reviews.author: Ed Borges

customer_reviews.title: Great little speakers for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I had some Paradigm Atom speakers used for my TV surround sound that were about 16 years old. I liked the sound but amazingly the woofers had foam surrounds rather than rubber. The foam deteriorates over time and the woofer starts making a horrible sound. I guess you can have them repaired or even buy the re-foam kit and do it yourself if you feel confident. I bought these because they seemed like good sounding and well built speakers, and at only twice the price as the rebuild kit are an excellent deal. Sound just as good as the Paradigm speakers for this application. I'm very happy with them, and for the price you can't really go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: heijboer

customer_reviews.title: Very good speakers
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the quality and sound of these speakers. Using them for the rear of a 5.1 surround system and they sound awesome. A very good buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hannon

customer_reviews.title: QUALITY/PRICE/REPUTATION OF POLK
customer_reviews.text: SO FAR I AM TRYING WITH DIFFERENT TYPES OF MUSIC ( CONCERTS OF DIFFERENT INSTRUMENTS, SOLO OR WITH ORCHESTRA/SINPHONIC/OPERA.ETC. ) AND THE SOUND IS VERY GOOD TOGETHER WITH THE CENTER SPEAKER BLACKSTONE TL1 FROM POLK, CONECTED TO MY OLD ( 1995 )TECHNICS SA-DX 930.I WILL COME BACK WITH MORE INFORMATION IN SOME TIME.( I HOPE WILL NOT NEED TO TRIM STARS )
customer_reviews.author: Jack FROM CHARLOTTE

customer_reviews.title: Well  Made and a Good  Value.
customer_reviews.text: Quality was evident throughout the speakers. Bass response is probably equal to the specifications. It does fall off at the low end and a sub- woofer would be a good addition. REW
customer_reviews.author: R. E. WORSLEY

product_meta.title: Polk Audio T50 150 Watt Home Theater Floor Standing Tower Speaker (Single, Black) - Hi-Res Audio with Deep Bass Response | Dolby and DTS Surround
product_meta.description: Style:T50| Configuration:SingleThe T50 is not your run-of-the-mill floor standing tower speaker. Just snap off the grill and take a look under the hood - you'll love what you see. With one 1" silk dome tweeter, one 6.25" extended throw composite driver, and two performance tuned front-firing sub bass radiators—all engineered with Polk’s proprietary Dynamic Balance technology, its highs send sound soaring, its mids are made to shred, and the bass you crave gets a massive boost even at the lowest frequencies. Its audio improved - for the people, by the people - signed, sealed and delivered! Easy to setup, supports Dolby and DTS, and connects to most home theater receivers, stereos or home theater processors. Have fun and play but prepare to be blown away.
feature_bullets: GET SUPERIOR HOME THEATER EXPERIENCE WITH IMMERSIVE SURROUND SOUND & HI-RES AUDIO. Featuring a 1" tweeter, a 6.5" Driver and (2) 6.5" Bass Radiators. The 2 bass radiators augment the main woofer and produce a well-balanced, natural warm sound reaching the far corners of the room

AMPLIFY YOUR MOVIE, MUSIC AND GAMING EXPERIENCE with this T-series speaker that not only sounds brilliant but also heightens your audio experience. Fill any small to medium sized room, produce captivating lifelike sound, which pulls you right into the heart of the action
CREATE A FULL-FLEDGED 5.1 HOME THEATER SETUP with the complete range of T-series speakers from Polk with two T50 Tower Speakers, one T30 Center Channel, two T15 Bookshelf speakers and a subwoofer
Polk speakers are COMPATIBLE WITH MOST HOME THEATER AV RECEIVERS giving you many setup arrangement options - in single or multi-room with 2.0, 2.1, 3.1 systems or an immersive 5.1, 7.1 or 9.1 setup

POLK'S UNMATCHED QUALITY AT AN AFFORDABLE PRICE. With these value-priced speakers, you can now enjoy premium acoustics, high quality construction, easy setup and a spectacular theater experience right at home

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars3,454 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
